revisions.rev:
{{TOC right}} This '''list of Macintosh software''' reveals [[Mac OS]] [[computer program]]s. Since the library of Mac OS programs is unmanageable, this list is confined to those programs for which a Wikipedia [[Wikipedia:What is an article|article]] exists.
For old software, see [[List of old Macintosh software]].
{{Expand list|date=August 2008}} <!-- Please add new entries alphabetically to the appropriate section. -->
== Audio == * [[Ableton Live]] â music production * [[Adobe Soundbooth]] â music and soundtrack editing * [[Ardour (audio processor)|Ardour]] â [[hard disk recorder]] and [[digital audio workstation]] program * [[Audacity]] â digital audio editor * [[Audion (software)|Audion]] â (development ceased) * [[Audio Hijack]] â audio recorder * [[baudline]] - signal analyzer * [[BIAS Peak]] - mastering * [[Cog (software)|Cog]] â open source audio player, supports multiple formats * [[Cubase]] â professional music production program * [[Djay (software)|djay]] â digital music mixing software * [[Digital Performer]] â MIDI sequencer with audio tracking * [[Final Cut Express]]/[[Final Cut Pro|Pro]] â movie editor * [[Finale (software)|Finale]] â [[scorewriter]] program * [[GarageBand]] â music/podcast production * [[HyperNext]] â freeware software development * [[iTunes]] â audio/video Jukebox * [[iVolume]] - volume normalization * [[ixi software]] â free improvisation and sketching tools * [[Jaikoz]] â mass tagger * [[Kontakt (software)|Kontakt]] â sampler, sample editor * [[LilyPond]] â A [[scorewriter]] program * [[Logic Express]] â [[Prosumer]] music production * [[Logic Studio]] â music writing studio package by [[Apple Inc.]] ** [[Apple Loops Utility]] â production and organisation of Apple Loops ** [[Apple Qmaster]] and [[Apple Qadministrator|Qadministrator]] ** [[Logic Pro]] â digital audio workstation ** [[Mainstage (software)|Mainstage]] â program to play [[software synthesizer]]s live ** [[QuickTime Pro]] â pro version of QuickTime ** [[Soundtrack Pro]] â post production audio editor ** [[WaveBurner]] â CD mastering and production software * [[Max (ripping software)|Max]] â free software CD ripper and audio transcoder * [[Mixxx]] - DJ mix software available for the mac in the App Store * [[Max (software)|Max]] â Cycling 74's visual programming language for MIDI, audio, video; with MSP, Jitter * [[Nuendo]] â audio and post production editor * [[ReBirth]] â virtual synth program simulates Roland TR-808, TB-303 * [[REAPER]] â digital audio workstation * [[Reason (program)|Reason]] â digital audio workstation * [[Recycle (program)|Recycle]] â sample editor * [[RiffWorks]] â guitar recording and online song collaboration software * [[Senuti]] â transfers music from iPod to computer * [[Sibelius (computer program)|Sibelius]] â [[scorewriter]] program * [[Sound Studio]] â digital audio analyzer and editor * [[Wiretap]] â digital audio recorder
''More at [[Digital audio workstation#Products|Digital audio workstation products]]''
== [[Computer-aided design]] (CAD) == :''See [[#CAD, 3D graphics|CAD, 3D graphics]]''
== CD and DVD authoring == * [[Disco (software)|Disco]] * [[DVD Studio Pro]], for professionals * [[iDVD]], a basic [[DVD]]-authoring application <!-- * [[PopCorn]], Writing Software --> * [[Roxio Toast]]
== Chat (text, voice, video) == * [[Adium]] â multi-protocol IM client * [[aMSN]] * [[AOL Instant Messenger]] * [[ChitChat]] * [[Colloquy (IRC client)|Colloquy]] â freeware advanced [[Internet Relay Chat|IRC]] and [[SILC (protocol)|SILC]] client * [[Fire (instant messenger)|Fire]] â open source, multiprotocol IM client * [[FaceTime]] - [[videoconferencing]] between [[Macintosh|Mac]], [[iPhone]], [[iPad]] and [[iPod touch]] * [[iChat AV]] â [[instant messaging]] and [[videoconferencing]] * [[Ircle]] * [[Irssi]] â IrssiX and MacIrssi * [[Kopete]] * [[Microsoft Messenger for Mac]] * [[Palringo]] * [[Proteus (instant messenger)]] * [[Psi (instant messenger)]] * [[Skype]] * [[Snak]] * [[Ventrilo]] â audio chatroom application * [[X-Chat Aqua]] * [[Yahoo! Messenger]] * [[Photo Booth]]
== Children's software == * [[Kid Pix]] Deluxe 3X â bitmap drawing program * [[Stagecast Creator]] â programming and internet authoring for kids
== Developer tools and [[integrated development environment|IDEs]] == {{seealso|Apple Developer Tools}} * [[Apache Web Server]] * [[Aptana]] â an [[open source]] [[integrated development environment]] (IDE) for building Ajax web applications * [[Code::Blocks]] â open source IDE for [[C++]] * [[CodeWarrior]] â development environment, framework * [[Coldstone game engine]] * [[Dylan (programming language)]] * [[Eclipse (computing)|Eclipse]] â open source Java-based IDE for developing rich-client applications, includes SWT library, replaces Swing by using underlying OS native windowing abilities * [[Fink]] â [[Deb (file format)|Debian package manager]] for [[porting|ported]] [[Unix]] software * [[Free Pascal]] â Object Pascal compiler, XCode plugin available * [[GNU Compiler Collection]] * [[Glasgow Haskell Compiler]] * [[HotSpot]] â Sun's Java Virtual Machine * [[ActiveState Komodo|Komodo]] â commercial multi-language IDE from [[ActiveState]] * [[Lazarus (software)|Lazarus]] â cross-platform IDE to develop software with [[Free Pascal]], specialized in graphical software * [[MacApp]] â application development framework [[Pascal (programming language)|Pascal]] and [[C++]] * [[Macintosh Programmer's Workshop]] (MPW) * [[Macromedia Authorware]] â application (CBT, eLearning) development, no Mac development environment since version 4, though can still package applications with the 'Mac Packager' for OS 8 through 10 playback * [[MacZoop]] â C++ [[application framework]] * [[Mono (software)|Mono]] â open source implementation of Microsoft [[.NET Framework]] with a [[C Sharp (programming language)|C#]] compiler * [[NetBeans]] â modular, open source, multi-language platform and IDE for Java written in pure Java * [[Omnis Studio]] â cross-platform development environment for creating enterprise and web applications for Mac OS X, Windows, Linux, Solaris * [[Panorama (database engine)]] * [[Perl]] * [[PHP]] * [[Python (programming language)|Python]] * [[Qt (toolkit)|Qt]] Creator â an IDE for C++ GUI applications, by [[Trolltech]] * [[Real Studio]] â cross-platform compiled [[REALbasic]] [[BASIC]] programming language IDE * [[ResEdit]] â resource editor * [[Revolution (development environment)|Revolution]] â high-level cross-platform IDE * [[Script Debugger]] â an [[AppleScript]] and [[Open Scripting Architecture]] IDE * [[SuperCard]] â high-level IDE * [[Tcl/tk]] - A scripting shell & GUI utility that allows cross platform development. Included With Mac OS X. * [[TextMate]] â very type-efficient multipurpose text editor supports Ruby, PHP, Python, many more * [[Torque (game engine)]] â powerful professional game creation software * [[WebKit]] â open source application framework for [[Safari (web browser)]] * [[WebObjects]] * [[wxPython]] â IDE merging [[Python (programming language)|Python]] and [[wxWidgets]] * [[Xcode]] â IDE made by [[Apple Inc.|Apple]], which comes as a part of [[Mac OS X]] and is available as a download, was called Project Builder
== E-mail ==
=== E-mail clients === * [[Mail (application)|Apple Mail]] â the bundled e-mail client * [[Claris Emailer]] â classic Mac OS only, no longer available * [[Microsoft Entourage|Entourage]] â e-mail client by [[Microsoft]]; analogous to [[Microsoft Outlook]] * [[Eudora (e-mail client)|Eudora]] * [[Lotus Notes]] * [[Mailplane (software)|Mailplane]] â a WebKit-based client for Gmail * [[Mailsmith]] â free e-mail client with extensive mail filtering, HTML-free, but no IMAP support * [[Microsoft Outlook]] * [[Mozilla Thunderbird]] * [[Mulberry (e-mail client)|Mulberry]] â open-source software for e-mail, calendars and contacts * [[Opera Mail]] * [[Outlook Express]]
=== Other e-mail software === * [[Spamfire]] - spam filter, no longer available * [[Gmail Notifier]]
== FTP clients == * [[Captain FTP]] * [[Classic FTP]] * [[Cyberduck]] * [[Fetch (FTP client)|Fetch]] * [[Fugu (software)|Fugu]] * [[FileZilla]] * [[Interarchy]] * [[Transmit (FTP client)|Transmit]]
== Games == {{main|List of Macintosh games}}
== Graphics, layout, and desktop publishing == === [[Computer-aided design|CAD]], 3D graphics ===
* [[Ashlar-Vellum]] â organic 2D/3D drafting, 3D modeling * [[ArchiCAD]] * [[AutoCAD]]<ref>http://usa.autodesk.com/adsk/servlet/pc/index?siteID=123112&id=15421056</ref> * [[Blender (software)|Blender]] * [[Cinema 4D]] * [[Google SketchUp]] â 3D modeling software * [[HighDesign]] * [[Houdini (software)]] * [[Lightwave]] * [[Maya (software)|Maya]] * [[Modo (software)|Modo]] * [[PowerCADD]] * [[VectorWorks]] * [[ZBrush]] * [[Siemens NX]]
=== Distributed document authoring ===
* [[Adobe Acrobat]] * [[Adobe Version Cue]] * [[Preview (Mac OS)|Preview]]
=== Icon editors, viewers ===
* [[IconBuilder]] * [[Apple Developer Tools#Icon Composer|Icon Composer]] part of Apple Developer Tools
=== File conversion and management ===
* [[Adobe Bridge]] * [[Font Book]] â font management tool * [[GraphicConverter]] - graphics editor, open/converts a wide range of file formats * [[iPhoto]] - a [[photo]] management application
=== Layout and desktop publishing ===
* [[Adobe InDesign]] â page layout * [[Pages (iWork)|Pages]] â part of [[iWork]] * [[QuarkXPress]] â page layout * [[RagTime (computer program)|RagTime]] * [[Ready,Set,Go!]] * [[Scribus]] â page layout * [[TeX]] â publishing ** [[MacTeX]] - TeX redistribution of [[TeX Live]] for Mac ** [[Comparison of TeX editors|Comparison of TeX Editors]] * [[The Print Shop]] â page layout
=== Raster and vector graphics ===
* [[Adobe Fireworks]] â supports GIF animation. * [[Adobe Illustrator]] â [[vector graphics editor]] * [[Adobe Photoshop]] â also offers some vector graphics features * [[Apple Aperture|Aperture]] - Apple's pro photo management, editing, publishing application * [[Corel Painter]] * [[Fontographer]] * [[GIMP]] â free [[bitmap graphics editor]] * [[GIMPShop]] â a free, open source, cross-platform [[bitmap graphics editor]] * [[Inkscape]] â a free [[vector graphics editor]] * [[MacPaint]] â painting software by Apple (discontinued) * [[Macromedia FreeHand]] â [[vector graphics editor]] * [[Paintbrush (software)|Paintbrush]] â a free simple bitmap graphics program * [[Photo Booth]] â photo camera, video recorder * [[Pixelmator]] â hardware-accelerated integrated photo editor * [[Seashore (software)|Seashore]] â open source, based around the GIMP's technology, but with native Mac OS X (Cocoa) [[user interface|UI]]
== Integrated software technologies == * [[Macintosh Finder]] * [[MultiFinder]] * [[Path Finder]] * [[QuickTime]] * [[Terminal (software)]] * [[X11.app]]
== Language and Reference Tools == * [[Dictionary (software)]] * [[Cram (software)]] * [[World Book Encyclopedia]] â multimedia * [[EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica]] * [[Rosetta Stone (software)]] â proprietary, a language learning software * [[Ultralingua]] â proprietary, electronic dictionaries and language tools
== Mathematics software == * [[Fityk]] * [[Grapher]] * [[Maple (software)]] * [[Mathematica]] * [[MATLAB]] * [[Octave (software)]] â open source * [[R (programming language)]] * [[Sysquake]] * [[SciLab]] â open source
== Media Center == * [[Boxee]] â Mac and Apple TV * [[Front Row (software)|Front Row]] * [[iTheater]] * [[XBMC]] now Plex * [[Centerstage]] * [[MythTV]] * [[SageTV]] * [[Mira]]
== Multimedia authoring == * [[Adobe Flash]] â vector animation * [[iLife]], a creative media suite by Apple * [[Adobe Director]] â animation/application development * [[Unity (game engine)|Unity]] â 3D authoring
== Networking and telecommunications== * [[Apple Remote Desktop]] * [[Google Earth]] * [[iStumbler]] â find wireless networks and devices * [[Karelia Watson]] (defunct) * [[KisMAC]] * [[Timbuktu (software)|Timbuktu]] â remote control
== News aggregators == * [[NetNewsWire]] * [[NewsFire]] * [[RSSOwl]] * [[Safari (web browser)]] - with built-in RSS support * [[Apple Mail]] â with built-in RSS support
== Office and productivity == * [[AbiWord]] * [[Adobe Acrobat]] * [[Address Book (application)|Address Book]] â bundled with OS X * [[AppleWorks]] (discontinued) * [[Bean (word processor)]] â free TXT/RTF/DOC word processor * [[Celtx]] * [[Circus Ponies NoteBook]] * [[Contactizer]] â a [[personal information manager]], was called OD4Contact * [[Delicious Library]] * [[FileMaker]] * [[iCal]] â [[calendar]] management â bundled with OS X * [[iDocument]], document management software * [[iWork]], consisting of ** [[Keynote (presentation software)|Keynote]] ** [[Pages (iWork)|Pages]] ** [[Numbers (software)|Numbers]] * [[iSync]] â bundled with OS X * [[KOffice]] * [[LibreOffice]] * [[Mariner Software|MarinerPak]] for Mac, consisting of ** [[Mariner Software|Mariner Write]] ** [[Mariner Software|Mariner Calc]] * [[Mellel]] * [[Microsoft Office]] for Mac, consisting of ** [[Microsoft Word]] ** [[Microsoft Excel]] ** [[Microsoft PowerPoint]] ** [[Microsoft Entourage|Entourage]] ** [[Microsoft Outlook]] * [[Montage (software)|Montage]] â screenwriting software * [[NeoOffice]] * [[Nisus Writer]] * [[OmniFocus]] * [[OpenOffice.org]] * [[WriteNow]] * [[Taste (software)|Taste]] â word processor (defunct)
== Operating systems == * [[Darwin (operating system)|Darwin]], the BSD-licensed core of Mac OS X * [[Mac OS X]] * [[Mac OS X Server]]
== Peer-to-peer file sharing == * [[Acquisition (software)|Acquisition]] * [[aMule]] * [[BitTorrent (software)|BitTorrent client]] * [[BitTyrant]] * [[Blog Torrent]] * [[Cabos]] * [[FrostWire]] * [[LimeWire]] * [[Poisoned]] * [[rTorrent]] * [[Tomato Torrent]] * [[Transmission (BitTorrent)]] * [[Î¼Torrent]] * [[Vuze]] â Bittorrent client, was Azureus * [[XNap]]
== Text Editors == <!-- Pure text editors only here, please. Word processors go under "Office and productivity". --> * [[ACE (editor)|ACE]] * [[Aquamacs]] * [[BBEdit]] * [[BBEdit Lite]] * [[Coda (web development software)|Coda]] * [[Emacs]] * [[jEdit]] * [[Nano (text editor)|Nano]] * [[SimpleText]] * [[Smultron]] * [[SubEthaEdit]] * [[TeachText]] * [[TextEdit]] * [[TextMate]] * [[TextWrangler]] * [[Vim (text editor)|vim]] * [[XEmacs]]
== Outliners and MindMapping == * [[2-plan project management software| 2-plan Desktop]], free project management software with integrated mind maps. * [[Inspiration Software|Inspiration]] * [[FreeMind]] * [[Mindjet]] * [[NovaMind]] * [[OmniOutliner]] * [[OmniGraffle]] * [[XMIND|XMind]]
== Utilities == * [[Activity Monitor]] â Default system monitor for hardware and software * [[AppZapper]] â uninstaller (shareware) * [[Automator (software)|Automator]] â built-in, utility to automate repetitive tasks * [[Backup (backup software)|Backup]] â built-in * [[BitDefender|BitDefender Antivirus 2009 for Mac OS]] â [[antivirus software]] * [[Butler (software)|Butler]] â free, launcher and utility to automate repetitive tasks * [[CandyBar]] â system customization software (commercial) * [[CDFinder]] â disk cataloging software (commercial) * [[Compact Pro]] â [[data compression]] * [[Dashboard (Mac OS)|Dashboard]] â built-in Mac OS X widgets * [[Duplicate Annihilator]] - detects and removes duplicates in [[iPhoto]] or [[Aperture (software)|Aperture]] * [[Grab (software)]] â built-in Mac OS X screenshot utility * [[Growl (software)|Growl]] â global notifications system, free * [[iArchiver]] â handles archives, commercial * [[Intego|Intego VirusBarrier]] for Mac - [[antivirus software]] * [[LaunchBar]] â provides instant access to local data, search engines and more by entering abbreviations of search item names, commercial * [[Little Snitch]] - network monitor and outgoing connection firewall * [[Mac Data Recovery Guru]] â Deleted File Recovery * [[MacScan]] â [[malware]] removal program * [[MarcoPolo (software)]] â context-aware computing * [[Mavis Beacon Teaches Typing]] â proprietary, typing tutor * [[Norton Antivirus]] for Mac â an antivirus program specially made for Mac * [[OnyX]] â a freeware system maintenance and optimization tool for Mac OS X * [[Quicksilver (software)|Quicksilver]] â A framework for accessing and manipulating many forms of data * [[Screen Sharing]] * [[SheepShaver]] â PowerPC emulator, allows, among other things, running [[Mac OS 9]] on Intel Macs * [[Sherlock (software)|Sherlock]] â file searching (version 2), web services (version 3) * [[Sophos]] Antivirus for Mac * [[Stuffit]] â [[data compression]] * [[Stickies (software)|Stickies]] â put [[Post-It Note]]-like notes on the desktop * [[System Preferences]] â default Mac system option application * [[Time Machine (Apple software)]] * [[UUTool]] â uuencoded/uudecode and other transcoding * [[Virex|VirusScan for Mac]] * [[WinZip]] for Mac * [[Xsan]] â storage network * [[Yahoo! Widget Engine]] â [[JavaScript]]-based widget system
===Support for non-Macintosh software===
* [[Bochs]] * [[Boot Camp (software)|Boot Camp]] included with Mac OS X from v.10.5 * [[CrossOver]]- commercial implementation of [[Wine (software)|Wine]] * [[DaisyDisk]] â Disk visualization tool * [[DOSBox]] â DOS emulator * [[Hercules emulator]] * [[pcAnywhere]] â VNC-style Remote control * [[Parallels Workstation]] â [[full virtualization]] software for [[Parallels Desktop for Mac|desktop]] and [[Parallels Server for Mac|server]], commercial * [[Q (emulator)|Q]] â emulates an [[IBM-compatible PC]] on a Mac, allows running PC operating systems * [[VMware]] â virtualisation software * [[Wine (software)|Wine]] â Windows API reimplementation * [[Virtual PC]], [[full virtualization]] software allows running other operating systems, such as Windows and GNU/Linux, on PowerPC Macs (discontinued in 2007) * [[VirtualBox]] * [[vMac]] â emulates a Macintosh Plus and can run Apple Macintosh System versions 1.1 to 7.5.5.
== Video == * [[Adobe After Effects]] * [[Adobe Premiere Pro]] * [[Avid]] * [[Chroma (software)|Chroma]] * Debut - video capture and screen recording from [[NCH Software]] * [[DivX]] * [[DivX Player]] * [[DVD Player (Apple)]] â DVD player software built into Mac OS X * [[FFmpeg]] â heavy-duty audio/video converter * [[Final Cut Express]] * [[Final Cut Studio]], a professional audio-video editing suite, consisting of ** [[Apple Qmaster]] ** [[Cinema Tools]] ** [[Compressor (software)|Compressor]] ** [[DVD Studio Pro]] ** [[Final Cut Pro]] ** [[LiveType]] ** [[Apple Motion|Motion 2]] ** [[Soundtrack Pro]] * [[HandBrake]] â DVD to MPEG-4 and other formats converter * [[iMovie]], a basic [[non-linear editing system|video editing]] application * [[Miro Media Player]] * [[MPlayer]] * [[Perian]] * Prism - video converter from [[NCH Software]] * [[QuickTime]], including its Player and QuickTime Pro * [[Real Player]] * [[Shake (software)|Shake]] * [[Total video converter]] â audio/video converter * [[Windows media player]] * [[VLC media player]]
== Web browsers == * [[Amaya (web browser)|Amaya]] â free * [[Camino]] â open source * [[Flock (web browser)|Flock]] â free, Mozilla Firefox based * [[Google Chrome]] â free, proprietary * [[iCab]] â free * [[Konqueror]] â open source * [[Lynx (web browser)|Lynx]] â free * [[Mozilla]] â open source, combines browser, email client, WYSIWYG editor * [[Mozilla Firefox]] â open source * [[Netscape Navigator]] â free, proprietary * [[OmniWeb]] â free, proprietary * [[Opera (web browser)|Opera]] â free * [[Safari (web browser)]] â built-in from Mac OS v.10 * [[SeaMonkey]] â open source Internet application suite * [[Shiira]] â open source * [[Internet Explorer for Mac]] â free, by Microsoft * [[WebKit]] â Safari application framework, also in the form of an application

* [[Claris Homepage]] * [[Coda (web development software)|Coda]] * [[Freeway (software)|Freeway]] * [[iWeb]] * [[NVu]] * [[Rapidweaver]]
